fields.description:
Clicking on 'Free trial' button for an add-on in the Manage Add-ons section of an instance pops up an Authentication banner (see attached)

This is only experienced when the logged in user is in the administrators group but not in the site-admins group.

Authentication always fails and after cancelling, the page refreshes and the user is not redirected to my.atlassian.com

*Workaround:*
* Add the user to the site-admins group

*Note:*
* The Fix should is scheduled to be rolled out on June 2
fields.summary: Authentication required popup to purchase add-ons

fields.description:
h4. Problem

Users with no activity (i.e comments, assigned, mentions) and groups cannot be deleted from Confluence-only instances. The error message is thrown:

bq. Error communicating with Confluence: Unauthorized

!delete.png!

h4. Cause

Request made by OnDemand user management fails to get validated.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Create new user or group.
# Try deleting the user/group.

h4. Workaround

* Deactivate users by removing all groups and application access from the user to free up required license.
* Deactivate a group by removing all users from it and removing it from all permissions.

***Note: This only affects Confluence-only OnDemand instances.
fields.summary: Groups and users without activity cannot be deleted from Confluence-only OnDemand instances

The problem is, the performance is slow, much slower than the other SaaS accounts I have used in the past.  Is there anyway to look to see what is going on with the slow performance?
fields.summary: Our transzap.atlassian.net site is very slow

fields.description:
When adding/editing the Navigation Map macro on Confluence OnDemand, the preview section shows the following error:{code}Error rendering macro 'navmap' : com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: You must specify a labelName.{code}Even though a valid label is specified.

The log displays the following warning:{code}WARN [TP-Processor8] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshalInternal Exception executing macro: navmap, with message: com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: You must specify a labelName.{code}After saving the page, the macro works though.

*Steps to reproduce*
Add a page
Add a label to this page
Edit the page
Add the Navigation Map macro
Input the label on the Label field
Click the Preview button
fields.summary: Error on the Preview section of the Navigation Map macro

fields.description:
Customers would like to more accurately know when their users last accessed their OnDemand instance. Displaying a 'last login' alone is insufficient, given users can select 'remember me' which means they could be continuously using the system but not have to pass through the 'login' page for some time.

We will be displaying a 'last activity' timestamp per user on the main /admin/users page, instead of the current 'last login' column. We'll keep displaying 'last login' on the individual user view, alongside 'last activity'.
fields.summary: Display last active timestamp for users

fields.description: I have numerous filters with custom columns on each filter. The columns I have set keep getting changed to the columns for a different filter. This happens all the time as I create new filters and adjust columns.
fields.summary: Custom columns for filters keep getting lost

fields.description:
Changes to the OnDemand purchase experience were [recently announced|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/OnDemand+Purchase+Experience+FAQ+-+May+2014] that will incorporate some of the functionality from MyAtlassian into our Atlassian OnDemand instances. There have been several comments on that page but no responses from Atlassian.

Specific questions I would like to get answers for are:
# Is there going to be a way to separate the ability to view/change billing information from creating/editing users?
# Is there going to be a way to disable the ability to start product trials?
# Is there going to be a way to disable automatic license changes aside from changing to a yearly subscription?
# It sounds like our billing contacts will now need Atlassian OnDemand accounts. Is there going to be any way to give them access to this functionality without having them count against our license count as we do today?

Ultimately I don't care where you put the billing functionality for Atlassian OnDemand, but I think there should be a separation between billing and production administration. My organization has a need for these functions to be separated, and it doesn't sound like we are alone in that regard.

I personally have no issues with everything remaining in MyAtlassian, it works perfectly fine for me.
fields.summary: OnDemand Purchase Experience Changes

fields.description: Since the update last night, we can no long apply values to the fix/affects version fields when creating a new issue.  I need this fixed as soon as possible.
fields.summary: Unable to edit the Fix Version / Affects Version fields

fields.description:
***Summary***
Last login in the user management page does not display login statistics for users using Google SSO. This makes the statistics not reliable.

***Steps to reproduce***
# Create user with Google Apps integration
# User logs in using SSO
# Check user's last login time
# User logs in using JIRA normal sign in
# Check user's last login time

***Workaround***
User needs to login without Google Apps for their statistics to be recorded
fields.summary: Last login Statistic is not recorded when users sign in using Google Apps

fields.description:
If a new user is created and its username has a space in between and an email is sent for the password to be set, when the user clicks the link on the email it receives a "No valid reset token found for user" error.
This also happens if the "Forgot password" link is used.

Workaround: The administrator of the application must manually reset the password, or replace the + in the username in the URL with a %20

fields.description:
Hello,

I am the admin for my JIRA account and now that we are adding client, we want to change my name and other team members to be prefaced with our compay initials for clarity. I have researched the forums on here and see that changing the admin name is no easy feat, almost next to impossible.

I wanted to know if I created a temporary TEST user, and gave that profile all of my rights (admin, developer, ect) and deleted my current profile and created a new one with the correct name and gave myself all the same accesses back if that would be a feasible work around.

The catch is, I am the author of pretty much everything in our JIRA on demand, and am not sure if deleting me, would then delete all the issues comments workflows, etc that I have created. Please advise.
fields.summary: JIRA Admin Name Change Workaround

fields.description:
After fixing error in authorising users to access Confluence, we now see to have hit a roadblock in getting users access to Bamboo.

I attempted to delete and re-add "Administrators-Bamboo" per Issue AOD-6984 and the workaround suggested there.  This was unsuccessful.

I deleted the affected user and re-added them as a user.  This ended up resulting in my getting the error as shown on the attached screen shot.  Also, when I attempted to check the "Bamboo" box for application access on the individual user's information in the User Management module, I received an error message with the prompt "you may want to try that again."

After several times of trying again, I decided I needed to submit a ticket, because there appears to be a bug here.

Further Language support for Atlassian Cloud constantly under review.

You can learn more about language support in Atlassian Cloud here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Languages

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 28th Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We are currently in the process of planning Russian, Portuguese-Brazil and Korean languages to be bundled with JIRA and Confluence in Cloud

Please do register your interest in your desired language by creating a new sub-task for the language or voting on an existing one listed.
{panel}

fields.description:
If the Group which is configured in the Global Permissions of an app does not exist, trying to grant them access shows the following error:
bq. 'There was a problem granting the user <Username> access to Application. You may wish to try the operation again'

This does not inform the admin why this occurs, thus it's not easy to find the exact reason.

*How to Fix*
# Go the Global Permissions of the Affects Application
# Check the group added which can log in ('JIRA Users' global permission for JIRA and 'Can use' permission for Confluence
# Create this group
* You can now grant access without errors
fields.summary: 'There was a problem granting user access to Application' error if Group defined in Global Permissions does not exist

fields.description: It would be nice if when you go to the *Group* tab it says exactly how many users are in each group.  Same for *Application Access*.  It's easy to count if there are only a few but if there are a lot this is difficult.

It would be nice to add a count above the list (showing 30 entries out of XX).
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to see the number of users in a group

fields.description: Where is my ability to manage user's profile picture?  The only thing I can do since your "simplified" interface is change name and email. Boo!
fields.summary: On Demand User Management lacks Profile Picture Ability

fields.description:
*Problem*

Today, you can sign up for certain Atlassian cloud products (Jira Software, Jira Service Management, and Confluence) under the subdomain of your choice. For example, if your company is Acme, you can host these products under *acme.atlassian.net*

The scope of "custom domains" on this ticket is to allow customers to use Atlassian cloud products on their own second-level domain, i.e. *jira.acme.com* or *acme.com/confluence*

{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - Nov 19, 2021}
Hi everyone,

I wanted to share an update on our progress, as we are acutely aware of the need for custom domains for many of our customers.

Atlassian reevaluates our product priorities on a quarterly basis, and we have just wrapped up another cycle of planning. I am proud to say that since the last update, my team has helped ship [self-serve site rename|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/changing-the-cloud-instance-url-address-or-migrating-to-a-new-cloud-instance-691011835.html] (another long asked for feature set) and are about to ship the much-needed improvements to [custom domains for email|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5614]. We’ve also been working hard to ensure that [admin.atlassian.com|https://admin.atlassian.com/] continues to meet the performance needs of our largest and most complex cloud customers.

These efforts illustrate the investments we’ve made in admin controls and performance, but it’s clear we need to do more. Unfortunately, this will delay our ability to invest in custom domains to the extent we originally planned. We are currently on a trajectory to deliver custom domains support in 2023 and are exploring options to accelerate the effort as well as to deliver incremental solutions ahead of that time.

We will continue to be transparent and provide timely updates, even when the news is not what we would prefer to share.

On behalf of the Atlassian team, we take your feedback seriously and understand both the frustration and the urgency. We are working hard to create the best overall experience for as many customers as possible, in line with [our company values|https://www.atlassian.com/company/values]. You can share your feedback with me directly: [ibagrak@atlassian.com|mailto:ibagrak@atlassian.com]

We plan to provide the next update on this feature by January 2022.

Best regards,
Ilya Bagrak
Principal Product Manager, Admin Experience
{panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status Update - 30 July 2021}
Hi everyone,

I work with [~dmeyer] and lead Atlassian’s custom domains team and will take over updates on our progress going forward. I know many of you have been eagerly awaiting one!

In the last 6 months, the team has reviewed our previous technical efforts on custom domains implementation, alongside general security improvements implemented by major web browsers, and we’ve achieved internal consensus on the new approach to deliver this feature for our Jira and Confluence cloud products.

I apologize that this update has not come sooner, but we have been quite busy taking our recommendation through internal security and architectural reviews, and I am happy to report that we are well on our way to fleshing out the execution plan. We will ramp up on execution over the new several months and continue to plan for an EAP for custom domains next year.

Security for our customers remains our highest priority and a place where we are unwilling to compromise. While we understand and have deep sympathy for the urgency of delivering custom domains, our focus in the last six months has been finding a more feasible implementation that meets customer requirements, without putting our customers at risk.

I also appreciate that many of you are puzzled by why something that appears so trivial at first glance would be so hard to deliver in practice. We are committed to helping our customers understand the unique complexity of getting a solution out there quickly and safely and are working on a blog post that will unpack some of the underlying technical challenges and constraints we’ve had to overcome.

Across Atlassian, we are committed to investing where we can have the greatest impact for the most customers possible. I encourage you to check out the full scope of our plans on [our public roadmap|https://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud], custom domains included.

On behalf of the Atlassian team, we take your feedback seriously and understand both the frustration and the urgency. We are working hard to create the best overall experience for as many customers as possible, in line with [our company values|https://www.atlassian.com/company/values]. You can share your feedback with me directly: [ibagrak@atlassian.com|mailto:ibagrak@atlassian.com]

We plan to provide the next update on this feature by January 2022.

Best regards,
 Ilya Bagrak
 Principal Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow custom domains for Cloud apps

fields.description:
Even with no available licenses, it is possible to create new users invitations. The invited users receives the invite request by e-mail and faces a error when try to sign up to the accounts:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/85750/Error%20when%20Signing%20up.png!

 I believe this is a bug, since the systems is not checking licenses availability before proceed with the invite creation.
fields.summary: It is possible to create new user invitations even with no available user licences.

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

For JIRA/Confluence instances specifically when adding new users to Confluence only. Create new Confluence only account with only confluence-users and users group. 

# Unable to de-select JIRA Access - forced to initially log into JIRA then switch to Confluence
# Access Denied - You have not been granted access to Confluence.

Other symptoms:
* JIRA users need Confluence access to browse projects (because 'users' group has Confluence Global Permissions) (?)
*  When adding a user to the "users" group, a Confluence License is used. (?)

h4. Workaround

Please raise a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com to request for further investigation. If confirmed, support will perform a restart which takes about 10 minutes to complete.
fields.summary: New instances of Confluence/Bamboo do not have new UM activated, users do not have access regardless application access settings

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a username or group with a + in it somewhere (this is a valid character in JIRA usernames).
# You're redirected to a page with a red banner that says "User does not exist", as a result you can't delete it either.

The only way to delete it is via the REST API. This appears to affect only usernames or groups with + in them, commas and hashes work fine.
fields.summary: Username or group with a + in it cannot be viewed or deleted

fields.description:
Confluence-users group removed from Global Permissions after upgrade.

Workaround is to just add it back to Global Permissions.
fields.summary: Confluence-users group removed from Global Permissions after upgrade

fields.description:
*Confluence (Error communicating with Confluence: Internal Server Error)* is being displayed when trying to create a new user and grant them Confluence application access, or grant an old user application access.

The following fix can be applied by any Confluence Administrator:
# Go to Global permissions in Confluence.
# Edit Permissions
# uncheck all permissions from the affected group (administrators-confluence)
# Save the permissions
** The Group will NOT be removed, instead it will remain in place with an option ticked that you removed
# Keep repeating step 3-4 until the Group no longer is shown on the Global Permissions page.
# Re-add the group.
fields.summary: Global permissions in Confluence being defined multiple times

fields.description:
On some instances, no users or groups appear in User Management, and anybody trying to log in via Agni will be unable to do so.

This is because our {{DummyDirectoryLocator}} simply sorts all directories by name and takes the first one, but these instances have more than the default "Studio Crowd" directory that just so happens to start with a character that precedes the default directory.

Thanks to [~ekaukonen] for diagnosing this.
fields.summary: Cannot view users/groups on any instance or log in on GApps instances

fields.description:
If a user that doesn't exist, or has been deleted, but explicitly has been given Global Permissions in Confluence, the Application Access page will display the following Error:
"An unknown error has occurred"
"Whoops!
We are currently unable to retrieve your licensing information for this product. Please try reloading the page in a few minutes."

*Fix*
# Go to Confluence Global Permissions
# Remove any permissions given to the deleted user
fields.summary: "We are currently unable to retrieve your licensing information for this product." error when nonexistant user has permissions in Confluence.

fields.description:
When in the Application Access screen, the following error shows for Bamboo:
*Error communicating with Bamboo: Internal Server Error* and users cannot be granted Application Access.

*Workaround/Fix*
# Go to the Bamboo Global Permissions screen
# Add your current user to the Global Permissions, and make it a limited-admin (this to make sure you don't lose Administrator access in the next step)
# Save
# Remove the *Administrators-bamboo* group from the Global Permissions (by unchecking all boxes)
# Re-add the *administrators-bamboo* group to the Global Permissions as limited-admin
* Check the Application  Access screen again.
fields.summary: Bamboo Application Access can't be granted
Unable to browse pages in the Groups section

fields.description:
When clicking on Next or Prev will cause multiple spinners to be displayed, eventually moving the text around.

The user will also be deposited on a page depending on how many times they've clicked. ie 10 clicks put you 10 pages further.

example: http://screencast.com/t/s6ePjJMQng4n
fields.summary: Clicking on Next or Previous multiple times causes strange behaviour

fields.description:
Users are being locked out from their instance and hitting into an *Invalid Credentials* error message. This issue is due to the fact that they have added themselves to the *'atlassian-addons'* group.

*Workaround*
Users that are added to the atlassian-addons group are periodically removed from that group by Atlassian's monitoring systems.
fields.summary: Applications admins are unable to log in to their instance, receive "Invalid Credentials" error

fields.description:
Newly created users in the system receive the message:

No valid reset token found for user

Impacts first-time users accessing the system and resetting the password they have been provided initially from the admin.

*Workaround:*
For a reset , please direct your users to:
*https://<instance>/login/forgot*
fields.summary: Password reset token valid for only 5 minutes

fields.description:
When a user is member of the "administrators" group but not a member of the "site-admins" group then they cannot access the user management.
The link is still displayed in the administration screen, when the user clicks on the link then he'll be re-directed to the login screen.

Steps to reproduce:

* create a user account and provide membership to the user group "administrators
* login with this account and press the cog -> user management
* Press the button "Leave Jira to go to user management:

You will be prompted with the login screen, no clear error message is shown.
fields.summary: lack of "site-admin" membership causes login loop when trying to access the user management

fields.description:
The password recovery link is looping back to the main login page. 

*Workaround*

Flushing cookies and browser cache and retrying the reset process resolve this issue.
fields.summary: Forgot password flow function is broken

fields.description:
If an instance has Pubic signup set, new users will not be granted access to the Application configured in 'Default Application Access'.

Users will only be given JIRA access, and will not be allowed into the other applications.

*steps to reproduce*
# Set instance mode to Public (done via JIRA Admin > General Settings)
# Go to User Management panel and confirm new users have default access to everything
# Sign up as a new user with a different browser
# Check the new users group memberships, they will only be in 'jira-users' group.

*workaround*
Add the jira-users group to Confluence Global Permissions as 'can use'. *note* this will cause the following behaviour when granting or revoking access: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/UNIFIED-28
fields.summary: Public sign-up does not grant access to anything other than JIRA

fields.description:
The token in reset password link send to newly created user with the new User Management for On demand Jira is not valid after 15 minutes.

This is not long enough. It should atleast be valid for a 24 hours period.
fields.summary: User Management : Reset password token not long enough

fields.description:
[User Management FAQ|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/User+Management+FAQ] says:
{quote}In existing instances, the 'users' group will continue to exist after the upgrade, but new users will no longer be added to that group by default. If you have given custom permissions to the 'users' group, we recommend migrating the permissions to these new groups.{quote}

*Problem:*
* Every new user is added to jira-users and confluence-users groups but not to 'users' group.
* All Project Role (Users) were set by default to the group 'users' in the past. (by Default, not manually, not custom)

*Result:* All new users can't browse or create issues in Jira because they don't belong to the 'users' group.
The way it used to work was changed and not all customers are aware of the change.

*Solution:*
* Add users to the 'users' group
* Add group 'users' to Jira Users Global Permission (that will trigger the user to be added automatically to the group upon creation)
fields.summary: New users can't browse issues - 'users' group is not default

fields.description: For instances that add Confluence after the new UM has been released do not have the confluence-users group added and no users are able to access Confluence.
fields.summary: Adding Confluence to an existing instance does not add confluence-users group

fields.description:
Users with no Application Access can still login.
They won't have access to the main functionalities or be able to search issues, navigate projects, etc but would still be able to see their profile and will get errors on some of the menu options.

If the user doesn't have Global Permission to Jira, then it stays in the same login screen as before (when having app access and no global permission).

*Steps to reproduce:*
# create a new user
# remove all application access
# log in with that user

See screenshots for visual explanation of symptoms.
fields.summary: Users with no Application Access can still login

fields.description: User management is currently broken in IE8.
fields.summary: UM currently broken in IE8

fields.description: If you've configured Google User Management to add users with default application access, it will continue to do so past your license limit.  This will show the red "exceeded" message on the application access page but does not seem to affect usage.
fields.summary: Creating users through GApps will add default application access even when license limit has been exceeded
